summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, commanding an individual to appear and testify in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell on November 29, 2021. The document is a formal legal order requiring personal appearance and production of items, with failure to comply constituting contempt of court.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual who is the subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for which the subpoena is issued to compel testimony.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Maxwell Case
events.description: A subpoena commands an individual to appear before the United States District Court to testify and give evidence in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued for an individual to testify in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The subpoena requires personal appearance on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906.
Failure to comply constitutes contempt of court and subjects the individual to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The subpoena is issued from the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case as of late 2021.
The document is a standard legal form (Rev. 02.01.12) used by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
